intro: Echium spathulatum, commonly known as the broad-leaved fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its striking blue to purple flowers and lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It is part of the Boraginaceae family, known for its hairy stems and showy blooms. Echium spathulatum is often found in coastal areas and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens.
